values:
everything was beautiful,


and nothing hurt.

my days overseas were absolutely mind blowing..
and pretty much 
all i know for certain is that i miss my brother and sister more than anything.

i gave him a star and he gave me the song that makes me cry above everything else.. 
and now we're the same and laugh with happy tears 
and whisper secrets and i couldn't ask for more.

on the twentieth 
we celebrated like kings and queens beneath the shade of the grandmother oak in the flats and fell in love with the park all over again.

i am old.

on the first, colleen gave me a beautiful hat to wear when i shall one day travel south for the derby and drink mint julips under the kentucky sun. 
the most thoughtful present ever.

besides the fact that my right eye was poisoned by toxic liquid shortly before arrival, 
prom was beautiful. 
late-night chez hagan will go down in history
as out of hand and glorious and everything it was supposed to be.

perfection.

and we danced and sang and realized the worth of eachother beneath the skies of youngstown's north side
and fell asleep to birds chirping and suns rising
and i'm endlessly going to miss my people when i'm gone.


..pittsburgh. =)


and for the first time in a long time
reality is falling into place

and we can almost taste the rays of endless days and olive skin and higher tolerance
of all things bright and beautiful.

today we spent our sacred half hour by the shrine with taco bell, grass stained knees, and assurance that we're doing what we're supposed to do.

and something magical happened in the green and orange room that i call home.. and it all makes me believe again that we are as sweet as someone thought
and oh, yes

we will go out with a bang.


and i can't believe it's almost gone.



..love. =)

ohh, the cruellest month..



inside my twelve day turtle shell i have enclosed:
1) some brand spankin new hippie skirts from tar(jay)
2) crime and punishment.. yumm.
3) a 100% genuine rock from the youngstown earth.. because i just can't bare to leave the yo behind.


and 365 days is an instant in real time. 
cushioned with single moments that rival infinity and steal the bigger part of the blanket in the middle of the night.
and don't forget to rock out slightly too hard, mes amis, because then you can't say you never did.


ohh, this boy..



a la France.

you know it's gonna be good.. ..when everybody raises their hand. my heart lies beneath the mahoning avenue bridge scrawled in green and pink paint. In Other News: 1. seventeen is almost done. 2. tv on the radio equals excitement in my body. 3. one-third of my family lives overseas. 4. the black donnelly's is my new favorite thing. 5. 34 days until airports and train stations. 6. bass player is in boston determining his future.. and youngstown is beautiful these days.

operation: smooth jazz = a complete success.


i need warm. everything. 

mornings, afternoons, and evenings too.

i need to write maggie and daniel a letter.




play needs to come together.



i sort of need ursuline to stop.


*last night i had a dream that the band was on a field trip to the ursuline motherhouse with all the nuns and nick and i decided to break policy and jump in the swimming pool while everyone else was at the continental breakfast. all the parents were trying really hard to figure out who did it but they never suspected nick and i who were all wet and wearing swimming trunks. the only person who knew the truth was my deceased kindergarten teacher: sister gabriel. she chased me out into the field behind mark's old neighborhood at which point i was transformed into an incarnation of dorothy gale with long curly red hair. we were running at toute vitesse through the grass and sister kept screaming at me: "i'm telling you to stop! stop!" but i kept screaming back "but you always taught me to fly!" then i jumped into the sky above canfield and left her in my dust.

weird.
but i'm pretty sure it's because colleen and i watched pocahontas before we went to bed last night.
we kept making jokes about chief powahatan and how he in reality graduated from ursuline high school in 1970 with john v.





oh, february.

Done!



god damn.

we are amazing.






and can we say mad props to a sweet weekend?
hell, yes.


hi. we graduate in < 5 months.

..you must leave now
take what you need, you think will last
but whatever you wish to keep
you better grab it fast
yonder stands your orphan with his gun
crying like a fire in the sun
look out baby, the saints are coming thru
and it's all over now, baby blue

the highway is for gamblers
better use your sense
take what you have gathered from coincidence
the empty-handed painter from your streets
is drawing crazy patterns on your sheets
the sky, too, is fallin over you
and it's all over now, baby blue..




oh, 2006.
and like always, that final week was epic and immaculate and monumental and beautiful and makes me love youngstown more than anything.
and i don't think there will ever be a more volatile or turbulent year in my life.
and when we drove past it.. there were candles in the windows and furniture in all the wrong places and helplessness. 
but i think everything is ready to begin again, and all the pieces are falling back together. 

my stars are realigning, and it's time to discover them all over again.




..leave your stepping stones behind,
there's something that calls for you
forget the dead you've left that will not follow you
your lover who had just walked thru the door
has taken all his blankets from the floor
the carpet, too, is foldin over you
and it's all over now, baby blue
well, strike another match
go start anew

and it's all over now, baby blue.

bobby and the amazing technicolor dreamcoat was swell.

friiday was snow in the yo. 
we sledded on the moon chez gregoire.
verrryy hyype.



school ends in nine days.. and oh, how i adore christmas break
and all my favorite people returning to youngstown..
=)


college will be applied to by the end of this week.


maybe.
if i have time.

alright, fine.

Back in Blue, bitches.


bass player's playing bass for play.

=)



ahh, don't you just love staying in on friday nights?
way to go, speech!




shit.

someone please remind me to apply to college.

thanks.

hmmm...


sadies was chinese food and dark side and 
fifth avenue taco bell with vlang and kyle.
one acts were bodacious and bittersweet and
ohh, bass playyerrr.
our mooney van = an effing work of art. 
i feel like i'm vacationing, but only in location sense.
operation: colleen and kelli time machine burying... 
is set to commence asap.



hi.
college?

ouch.





.:nothing really compares to.. Barcelona:.
All that is now All that is gone All that's to come and everything under the sun is in tune but the sun is eclipsed by the moon.

Done.


Whoever said summer reading couldn't be completed in one day?

suckers.
=).

Forever in Our Hearts. ...in other news... paco and i were assaulted.. again. yay september. and when all else fails, drive to cleveland. =) I am officially starting Lit now. Wow. Okay, time me. Ready, Set, Go...
"My arms are so victorious right now!!" we are awesome.

alriite, kids. here's some oldies... ..mafia. winslow's on the first. how i appeared on my seventeenth birthday.. mystery solved. my sheets are green and probably fifteen years old. bamboo, hammer, and jMo. ..surpriizizzled. ..ohh, these kids. =) ..bass player. play-ed out. marry me? tunnel = love. hey, it's summer. =)

joy.


absolute, pure joy.



..go be ridiculous, kids.






Daaave Concert.. =).

alright.. LISTEN, Mary Bess.


word perfect decides not to open itself.

tears of sadness.. or joy..?

i just really hope she doesn't give me a mean look tomorrow.


..same thing is happening to jMo.
coincidence?
or divine intervention?



ohh, geez.
 
on the bright side, no effing research paper to finalize tonite.
and it makes room enough for adventures.



sooo.. apparently last nite was the party nite on madera.
hell yeah.
go mrs. edwards.

it was pretty thrilling that a large gathering of ursuline teachers was happening so close to the madness of our little shindig.


here's to penguins and jack and pineapples and rooftops.

woot woot.



tomorrow =..

5.30.06

I HEART THE YO.

If you do... Ursuline. Shrine. 3:15. Be There, Bitchess..

Beautification Project of the Yo.
Clean Up of Wick and Surrounding Areas.

Do a Sweet Job and be Crowned King or Queen of Trash!

Help Me, Caitlin, and Jenna get an A on our Government Final!

COME!





..i can't believe i'm not writing my research paper.


shit.

thunderstorms. ^_^



there's something about dangerous circumstances that makes me love my family beyond words.



my mom lit her lady of guadalupe votive candle and sat in front of the tv yelling out whenever don gave another warning like: "time to get down in your bathtubs, folks."
colleen camped out in the basement.
a fort complete with blankets, flashlight, drink boxes, and enough peanut butter sandwiches to last the three of us the whole night.



john v. was in his glory
and assured me he was positive he could probably take the tornado head-on.
so me and him spent most of the ordeal on the front porch looking for funnel clouds and planning elaborate escape routes in case of any actual danger.


we were all giddy children, excited for some real action.
it was love.



so.. thunderstorms = summer, no?
eight days. 
i need skirts and no shoes
and nights under the stars
when nick won't put down his guitar
and we glycerine and wonderwall and creep
and lay on blankets that smell like bonfire
and infinite grass stains on my knees.




'Things fall apart;
the center cannot hold;
Mere anarchy is loosed upon the world..'

#5 and counting.

this weekend is campfires and cousins
and maggie and daniel
with the windows down and 80 degrees fahrenheit please
driving with dave on repeat and fancy hats i think
research paperrr and algebra out of my ass
but its all okay because
i can see the end by now.


oh, summer.
what will you be?


time for adventures, i think.

delirious.

why are there always ants around when research papers are being written?

Jack Kerouac, Allen Ginsberg, Gregory Corso, William S. Burroughs.

freedom of thought, creativity, spirituality, free love, drugs, promiscuity, coffee houses, bongos, counter-culture. 


ohh, play.
pretty much its just a contest of seeing how many costumes you can change into and out of in a short amount of time.

plus love with the kids in the tunnel and maggie's black and blue polka-dot dress.


Thursday, Friday, Saturday
7.30
Sunday 
Matinee.


works cited page. shit.


i hope you can see my middle finger loud and clear, mary bess.




"Well, Beatniks for one."






developing a cold
a couch
la grippe
la post nasal drip

..come to the play, bitches.




fouuurrrttteeeeennnn.

ohh, youu kiddss.

there are few things better than an absolute surprise.
and silly string in your hair.
and bloody stick beaten pinatas,
princess crowns,
and cheesing on hammocks underneath the stars.

so mad props to bamboo and jMo and every other person in the world for keeping it a secret.
except maybe.. nataliee. hahaaa. 
j slash k yo.



it kind of makes me crave summer that much harderrr.


school is ridiculous..
we're just not gonna talk about it.



but anyways you all better come to our play, jerks.
it's sweet..
?

no.. it is.
be there.
info to come later.



today my grandmother and i sat on an oversized couch
and watched the kentucky derby..
and i think that one day
i shall travel to louisville
and wear a fancy hat and drink some mint julips
and bet large sums of money on the horse with the prettiest name.
..yeah.




seeing the world through ambervision aviators
with the waking life soundtrack on repeat
and windows down, past all those crazies in the yo
makes the days that much better.

and lately my favorite part is between 2.45 and 3.30 
where we throw around ideas before always deciding to win slow.
or sometimes i'll be kidnapped by The Shaggin Wagon 
and we'll patronize adorable lemon shake stands downtown.

it's love.



*twenty-one. o_O

seventeen.

fantastic birthdayyy.
sleeping in till late and the price is right
school from lunch till 2.45 is never too bad.
my locker is so kelli it's ridiculous.
props to bamboo and jMo.
birthday beads and badges
and winslow celebrated too.
these kids are pretty much the best ever.

oh, daaaave.
tickets for june 7th in hotlumbus.
last day of school.
rock on.

so it was a sweet birthday.
except that the amount of homework
to be done is ridiculous.
not thinking about that noww..

Steph!
happy birthdayy!

woot woot!



prom was ridiculously fun.
me and nick were so mafiaa.
everyone was really hot.
pictures coming soon o_O

and oh my goodness the fancy hats that were worn that nite.
=)
it was lovely.

yesterday we picnic'ed and lake glaciered on the shore and slept on blankets with nick guitaring
and mark eating so much watermelon, 
while me jenn and cait stuck to the pineapple. hahaa.



hi, so.. summer.
fireworks and bonfires and cookouts and skirt-wearing and staying up to watch the stars.
oh geeez. 
37 days.
love.

ohh, spring break.


it was a very, very Good Friday.. yess.

and cousins rock my socks.

bamboo, jMo, and i conquered cleveland yesterday.. caitlin is probably the greatest driver on the face of the earth.
and we bob marleyed with ambervision aviators the whole way home.


bad job to teachers who give ridiculous homework over break.
and bad job to me for being the worst procrastinator ever.




thank you for being beautiful outside.


i purchased DMB listener supported.. fantascohh.
buy me tickets for my birthday.


i also picked out a prom dress.
red, red wine.
nick and i are going as "mafia".
yesssss.
that day should probably be ridiculously awesome.
score.


tacos are done o_O.

i hate the prison that is 5:50 am on monday thru 2:45 pm on friday.



i picked up ryan and we ventured out to austintown
and stood in driveways for awhile
before deciding to be adventurous and playground.

my jeans got very wet.
ryan had alot of fun i think..

i used to think the saddest song ever
was moonlight sonata on the piano.

..but then i heard it on bass.
o_O


its not as warm as i thought it was
=/
and i sort of hate sunset
for taking me away from blankets in stoner's field
and boys with guitars.



so.. all of the important grade determining homework i had
is in my bookbag which is lost.. somewhere.

thanks, god.


but at least now i dont have to do it.

and oh geez.. there's a godfather marathon on amc. 

so im prolly better off this way.



but im still sort of craving warm-ness in the park
and orange walls
and rockstar coats
and bass guitar..


and i think someone should come kidnap me, please.


ohh, summer.
"..Mais tu es pur, et tu viens d'une etoile.."

Saturday. March 25th, 2006. Approximately 10:30 am...

"Kelli, i think i'm starting to like this."

"Shit.. i know. Me too."




***
celebrate was fun. yeah, i said it. nick and i thoroughly enjoyed ourselves.

there was singing and guitars and sleeping on cold floors.
and tissue boxes and stuffed animals of monkeys.


and i got some letters that put mascara all over the pages. filled with valuable life lessons and also detailed instructions on how one should care for an egg.




and documented on nick's digital camera is an attempt to acquire a very hot black eye 
by this bass playing boy i know.
i'm pretty sure the first knuckle on my right hand is broken..
but it's very okay.
we had fun.

=)




school needs to die.


now.



i need to just be in youngstown as much as possible. 
canfield is suffocating.

so heeeyy.. urban explorations this weekend fo sho.
bring the cameras, kids. 


i take the SAT on saturday.
?!?!?!

snap. 



john v. just came in and informed me that he will take myself and some other kids to pitt anytime we want.
o_O.

oh, college. 
maybe i won't go and just become a rockstar. hahaa..



*c'est tout.

ohh geez.

these days my life pretty much revolves around:
1) le petit prince.
2) finding ways to not do homework.
3) regina spektor.

other than that..
it's ridiculously fun weekends that keep happening for some reason.

i always seem to find myself in random home bathrooms with these two kids i know.
aw gee.


and secrets on trampolines at 12:45 am eastern standard time make me smile.



apparently, our basketball teams are sweet.
but meaghan and i were too busy looking for bizarros.
speaking of jesus, it's her birthday today.
woot!

the ides of march.

"Et tu, Brute'?"

"Et tu?"

"Guys, are we.. mad...  at?"
*exaggerated inflections*
"Are we? ...mad? ...at?"

canton, ohio was fun. props to ermengarde and jamaica for that.



ursuline goes to hotlumbus tomorrow. oh my. 
and regardless of whether or not we win..

me and some kids are going on friday too.

yes.

that's right.

st. patrick's day.

in columbus.

o_O.



so it's a guaranteed awesome next few days. score.



nicholas james celio/nick baker/mike stein will be in effing boston, massachusetts on friday.
jerks.
i hope they appreciate all of the ridiculously attractive hot irish boys with boston accents.

oh my god.


speaking of jewish,
nick, jMo and i went to mike's synagogue on monday.
it was fantastic.
and i would really like to be jewish now, please.


that's all.

party hardy, kids.

THE CRUCIBLE

February 24, 25 @ 7:30pm
February 26 @ 3:00pm

Call Ursuline for tix, bitches.



come, you jerks.

Me: "I dissected a sheep heart today in Anatomy.. it was pretty disgusting."

John V.: "Oh Kel, I could tell you some stories about dissections... *chuckles*..

Me: "Oh?"

John V.: "Well, let's just say that we did some rather illegal stuff back in the day. All in the name of learning, of course."




One time, my father and his buddies 'pulled a fast one' on The Ohio State University Medical School.. stealing the head of a cadavre, and taking it back to their house to study with for one of their final exams.






Oh, John V.
=)

me + caitlin + mike stein + mafia
=
limo, tom-tom, and o.a.r.
backstage passes and
standing outside in the cold is made even better
when the ride home is the best part.

mandela bellamy is probably my hero.
along with vickey mcbride
and corneeliiuss.
and the sweetest debaters ever.



my life pretty much revolves around the olympics these days.
i must admit, i'm a huge bode miller fan
and can probably give you the all the latest 
on figure skating drama.

other than that 
my life is spent waiting for 2:45 pm on friday
and dreading 5:50 am on monday.

oh, and play.

its tech week, yuck.
time and info to come later.

till then, 
it's daniel's blue car 
and gregoire's o.a.r. cd 
on repeat
waiting for the heat to work.


*c'est tout.

good weekend.


and sweet nelly i nearly had a heart attack probably seven times in the past four days.

in several weeks, a small hotel room in canton, ohio shall be met by natalie suzelis, mandela bellamy, and myself.
ohhhh maan.

needless to say, we were thrilled. 
and celebrated accordingly on saturday night.
in the most beautiful seashore palace i've ever seen.

mandela proved herself worthy to jamaican heritage.
dan almost set his girlfriend on fire.
steph and i found ourselves three inches tall surrounded by fake furniture.
and caitlin wore a very fancy hat on her head all night long.

it was lovely.



and one of my favorite things is when the friends that you're missing 
call on the phone
to make you smile.


Of.A.Revolution = 41 hours and counting = sex.





oh,

and pittsburgh is God.

EDGE

The woman is perfected.
Her dead

Body wears the smile of accomplishment,
The illusion of a Greek necessity

Flows in the scrolls of her toga,
Her bare

Feet seem to be saying:
We have come so far, it is over.

Each dead child coiled, a white serpent,
One at each little

Pitcher of milk, now empty.
She has folded

Them back into her body as petals 
Of a rose close when the garden

Stiffens and odors bleed
From the sweet, deep throats of the night flower.

The moon has nothing to be sad about,
Staring from her hood of bone.

She is used to this sort of thing.
Her blacks crackle and drag.


5 February 1963

Sylvia Plath


"Six days later, Ms. Plath put her children to bed, and closed the kitchen door; sealing it with dish towels. She opened the door of the oven, and turned on the gas."

i internally self combust everytime it snows two hours later than it should.
thanks, god.





me, nick, and john v. are leaving yompton on friday to go to columbus.
o_O. 
i'm very excited. 






"The 'Eddie Loves Debbie' Beautification Project of The Yo" is still in its infant stages, but i think it's gonna be sweet. 
..best government project ever..?




mrs. stolle gave us brochures for the france trip next year.

oooohhhh mannn.



school is hell these days.
except 20 degrees.


shit.

friiday the thirteenth.

angela, jenna, paul, vlad, jon, jeff and i decided to be daring
and once again we found ourselves
pulling down that narrow stretch to lipply road.

we bitch slapped the barbed wire and no trespassing signs
and cheesed for awhile with three witches..
and jon even stuck his arm in the hole. 

needless to say, 
mr. lipply wasn't too happy to see us.

red and blue lights and
a big fat sergeant who smoked his cigarette
in our faces and shined his light in my eyes
and made me cry.

but luckily
the constitution was on our side.



mmm.. a nice adventure to add to the list.


zombie land anyone?

christmas break was beautiful.

and like always, that week in between christmas and new year's was lovely and surreal and nothing but lazy suspended animation and sleeping in til one o'clock and six feet under episodes playing in my family room and driving in cars with maggie and daniel and life altering events that always seem to map out where next year is heading.
i'll miss it.

new year's eve exceeded my expectations by a thousand percent. 
it was classy and swanky and set the bar high for other new year's eves to come.
caitlin received mine and jMo's birthday present exactly two months late.
and..
we rocked out.
..much.

please just allow me to say..
those friends of mine are awesome.

2005 was full to the brim. there were lots of milestones. tragic and beautiful. 
i'm sort of exhausted of things being interrupted and changed and shifted and things moving all around.         but, that's life, right?        slow down, guys.
it was a year of highs and lows. 
and somehow.. so much of it seemed to revolve around one week in july, where i went to this beach with some people i love.

i've changed my whole outlook on life, actually. i have a list full of resolutions that would bore you all to death. but i'm pretty excited.

theres this driving urgent feeling inside me that just really believes 2006 will be sweet.
that's promising.
and so is the old, jamaican, rastafari man that keeps telling me
..everything's gonna be alright.

it will.


*c'est tout.

new york was love. there were fifteen of us.. and it was sweet. our hotel rooms were amazing. and we did/ saw a lot of awesome stuff. it was all just ridiculous fun.. all the time. and i can't wait to go back. but i missed the yo... and it's good to be home. =) here's picturesss. scroll down a bit and click on slideshow>> new york city. *c'est tout.

New York City.

two days.

ooooohhh wow.

play was sweet.
and the cast party last night was awesome.
yay for piano playing and dancing the merengue in the living rooms of huge houses on the north side.
very fun.

try-outs for the winter drama are wednesday, mmm.


maggie and daniel are home for until after new years.. sweet.
they both won tickets to the ohio state-notre dame game.. o_O


9 days until ursuline break.



let's go sledding at the ridge. pleease.



oh.

and remember.


whatever you do...

DON'T drink the Fanta.

fantastic weekend. varsity was wednesday. that was great. ridiculous fun. mostly because there was absolute snow everywhere. justin vlad ang and me ate out before at mcdonalds.. we almost died trying to drive to the north side. vlad achieved the all time record for slow driving. but we got there alive. we had an interesting time. then we went to the dance which was awesome. afterwards was mike steins. sweetness. picturesss. =). click on slideshow.. its alot of fun. varsityo5 thanksgiving was nice. mostly i just love my cousins more than anything. on thursday we went to john butler's and were cold but had a great time. we came back to my aunt's and me plus maggie and my cousins katie shannon and nicole all slept in one bed. i felt like i was six again. friday i saw rent with maggie and my mom. ...we cried. last nite was dinner at the mvr with my whole family and then cousin's club at my cousin megan's. amazing fun. we played spades and other assorted card games and i almost peed my pants alot. it was great. 27 days until christmas eve. 23 days until no more school. please snow more. *c'est tout.

***ATTENTION, ATTENTION, ATTENTION***

 

FOUND: http://profile.myspace.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=user.viewprofile&friendID=11473766&Mytoken=B01C00B2-922C-4844-A0D7CF0427AC963F184841281

YOU WILL NOT BE DISAPPOINTED. DO IT. NOW.

 

mad props to caitlin.. the original finder of this treasure.

columbus was hype.

very hype.


maggie and bridget's room is sweeter than everything.

the next day, i went to daniel's french class and definitely knew everything that was going on. 

..but then i fell asleep in his astronomy.

my family went to eat at Bucca diBeppo. on the way, daniel's car started billowing out smoke so we pulled over. the next 45 minutes were just way too surreal and it was really fun. plus i ate a lot of food.

and on the way home last nite me and my mom listened to this amazing cd that maggie had burned.. and it was pretty much a life-changing experience.
rent. a lot. 
only twenty-ish days.



i can't wait for thanksgiving. and parades. and cousins. and food. and snow.


yesss..
=)




*c'est tout.

nick was a kissing booth.

jimmy was hurricane katrina.. complete with tiny lego people and a spraying water bottle.


after school.. cait/jimmy/nick/i ventured into oak hill cemetery.. where we saw an actual grave being dug. caitlin took sweet pictures of all the ridiculous gravestones of youngstown's old millionaire families. 

then we saw four stray dogs running toward us. so we left.

it was sufficiently creepy and we hope to return once it snows to get better pics. i especially heart how all the roads are brick. it makes me want to be a wick or arms or butler heiress and drive my carriage through the cemetery.



time for mischief making.

"An Evening of Student Directed One-Acts."

Saturday, October 15. 7:30 pm.

Ursuline Auditorium.

Admission: FREE. (but bring some canned goods if you can.. to help the poor people.)



PING-PONG.
written by kelli craig and directed by kelli craig and liz engler.



**mine goes first kiddos.. so don't be late.
i advise coming early for a seat seeing as pretty much the whole school is planning on attending.**


BE THERE!

..riiidiculous.


sadies?
psshhhh.

effing weezer.


the magic number was 90. 

yes.
..90.

reese's van.
oh wow.

they played all the good stuff. and i called bamboo for all the sweet ones. =)
say it ain't so.
buddy holly.
sweater song.. ohh maan.

foo fighters kicked major ass.
